availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Appointments by the Governor, Civil Appointments, 1863-1867

body.p:
State of Tennessee
Shelby County ss

I. J. W. Westcott being first duly sworn made oath that I will well and faithfully to the best of my knowledge and ability discharge and execute all the duties of Commissioner of Deeds for the State of Kentucky in the State of Tennessee an offer to which I am appointed by His Excellency the Governor of Kentucky by commission under the Great seal of the state of Kentucky dated October 5th AD 1865 said commission generated under act of the General Assembly of said Common wealth of Kentucky, chapter 70 of the Revised Statutes approved January 7th 1852

Sworn to and subscribed before the Judge of the Common Law and chancery court of the city of Memphis this 9th day of October AD 1865 Witness my hand and the
seal of said court In Duplicate --

figure.ab:
COMMON LAW & CHANCERY COURT OF THE CITY OF MEMPHIS
SHELBY COUNTY
TENN

body.p: The following is an impression of my seal and my official signature.

figure.ab:
CITY OF MEMPHIS TENNESSEE
COMMISSIONER OF DEEDS

body.p:
J. W. Westcott
Commissioner of Deeds
for Kentucky in Tennessee

Comr Deeds
Tennessee
Oath of J. W. Westcott
filed
14th Oct 1865
